DataElement.preferredDefinition: Name that describes the gene related to IDH2 mutation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure IDH2 Gene Mutation Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A change in the nucleotide sequence of the IDH2 gene._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of the IDH2 gene.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of the IDH2 gene.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

DataElementConcept.origin: DCI CRF:  Duke Cancer Institute Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for IHC Monitoring form for brain cancer study in Rave as requested by M. Leonard. mc 12/13/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A nucleotide substitution at position 515 of the coding sequence of the IDH2 gene where guanine has been mutated to adenine.

Concepts.definition: A nucleotide substitution at position 515 of the coding sequence of the IDH2 gene where guanine has been mutated to adenine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A change in the amino acid residue at position 172 in the isocitrate dehydrogenase [NADP], mitochondrial protein where arginine has been replaced by methionine.

Concepts.definition: A change in the amino acid residue at position 172 in the isocitrate dehydrogenase [NADP], mitochondrial protein where arginine has been replaced by methionine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A change in the amino acid residue at position 172 in the isocitrate dehydrogenase [NADP], mitochondrial protein where arginine has been replaced by glycine.

Concepts.definition: A change in the amino acid residue at position 172 in the isocitrate dehydrogenase [NADP], mitochondrial protein where arginine has been replaced by glycine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Human IDH2 wt allele is located in the vicinity of 15q26.1 and is approximately 18 kb in length. This allele, which encodes isocitrate dehydrogenase 2 (NADP+) mitochondrial protein, plays a role in intermediary metabolism. Mutations in this gene are associated with astrocytoma, oligodendroglioma and secondary glioblastoma.: A change in the amino acid residue at position 172 in the isocitrate dehydrogenase [NADP], mitochondrial protein where arginine has been replaced by methionine.

Concepts.definition: Human IDH2 wt allele is located in the vicinity of 15q26.1 and is approximately 18 kb in length. A change in the amino acid residue at position 172 in the isocitrate dehydrogenase [NADP], mitochondrial protein where arginine has been replaced by methionine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of the IDH2 gene.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A nucleotide substitution at position 515 of the coding sequence of the IDH2 gene where guanine has been mutated to thymine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A change in the amino acid residue at position 140 in the isocitrate dehydrogenase [NADP], mitochondrial protein where arginine has been replaced by another amino acid. Mutations at this position are found in patients with acute myeloid leukemia following myelodysplastic syndromes and is associated with shorter overall survival.

Concepts.definition: A change in the amino acid residue at position 140 in the isocitrate dehydrogenase [NADP], mitochondrial protein where arginine has been replaced by another amino acid. Mutations at this position are found in patients with acute myeloid leukemia following myelodysplastic syndromes and is associated with shorter overall survival.
